metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25632 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The rmmodimplementation allows the unloading of a module used as a dependencywithout checking if any other dependent module is still loaded leading to ause-after-free scenario. This could allow arbitrary code to be executed ora bypass of Secure Boot protections. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.167.2+2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.167.2+2.04-1ubuntu44.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2-unsigned package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu44.2').
grub2-signed package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.167.2').
grub2 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
